manage module

Django’s command-line utility for administrative tasks.

manage.main()

Run administrative tasks.

This function is the main entry point for running administrative tasks in the Django project. It sets the ‘DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE’ environment variable to ‘WebSite.settings’, which specifies the settings module to use for the Django project.

The function then tries to import the ‘execute_from_command_line’ function from the Django core management module. If the import is successful, it proceeds to execute the command-line arguments passed to the script using ‘execute_from_command_line’. If Django is not installed or not available on the PYTHONPATH, it raises an ImportError and provides a helpful error message.

Note

Before running administrative tasks, ensure that Django is installed and available on the PYTHONPATH. Also, make sure to activate a virtual environment if required.
